speaker: Maelle
line: Papa did it so easily. What am I doing wrong?

speaker: Monoco
line: Don’t be discouraged. It’s only been a day since you remembered your Paintress side.

speaker: Esquie
line: We believe in you!

speaker: Verso
line: Remember them. Painting isn’t about verisimilitude. It’s about essence. The truth of who they are. Your father made the Axons, right?

speaker: Monoco
line: She Who Plays with Wonder. He Who Guards Truth With Lies.

speaker: Verso
line: They’re the essence of your mother. And… your brother.

speaker: Lune
line: How did we—

speaker: Sciel
line: We gommaged…

speaker: Lune
line: Maelle… Your hair?

speaker: Maelle
line: We have much to talk about.

speaker: Lune
line: So you are her daughter. And you are a Paintress too.

speaker: Esquie
line: So cool, right??

speaker: Lune
line: And you. You knew this whole time. You fucking coward. You betrayed us. We trusted you and you—

speaker: Sciel
line: You can bring them back too, yeah? Everyone we’ve lost.

speaker: Maelle
line: I— Yeah. But I need chroma. And Papa controls all the chroma in the Canvas.

speaker: Lune
line: No. Not all of it. The Expeditioners, the ones killed by Nevrons. Gustave noticed their Chroma remains in their bodies. They never dissipated, like the Gommage.

speaker: Maelle
line: Hmmm. It’s old chroma, not pure. It won’t be like bringing the two of you back, but… we could use it in other ways.

speaker: Monoco
line: Time for the greatest Expedition in history.

speaker: Esquie
line: Oooooh, everyone’s mad at you.

speaker: Verso
line: Are you?

speaker: Esquie
line: Esquie can be sad or bad or even rad! But never ever mad. Bad things happen when we get mad.

speaker: Verso
line: Oh, I know.

speaker: Esquie
line: But I can never be mad at you.

speaker: Sciel
line: Save it.

speaker: Sciel
line: I don’t need your mea culpa. You did what you felt you had to. Of course, you were wrong, but… oh, well.

speaker: Verso
line: I thought you’d be more upset.

speaker: Sciel
line: I was. I got over it.

speaker: Sciel
line: Everything I knew about our world is wrong. And you know what? I don’t care. ‘Cause death isn’t death anymore. And that means, I can see my husband again.

speaker: Verso
line: Sciel…

speaker: Sciel
line: Oh, please. I’d sacrifice you in a heartbeat to get him back, so… I understand. We’re good.

speaker: Verso
line: Thank you.

speaker: Sciel
line: As long as you help me bring Pierre back. You owe me.

speaker: Verso
line: You got it.
